summary.title: Practice Exercise 1
summary.description: This project contains the data flow diagrams for the coffee ordering web app from Practice Exercise 1.

diagrams.title: Data Flow Diagram for When a Customer Places an Order

threats.title: Customer Account Spoofing
threats.description: An attacker could impersonate a legitimate customer to place fraudulent orders or access their order history.

threats.title: Staff Account Spoofing
threats.description: An attacker could impersonate staff to manipulate order statuses, access sales reports, or modify menu items and application configurations.

threats.title: Web Application Server Spoofing
threats.description: An attacker might set up a fraudulent web server to phish user credentials or intercept sensitive data.

threats.title: Customer Account Spoofing
threats.description: An attacker could impersonate a legitimate customer to place fraudulent orders or access their order history.

threats.title: Staff Account Spoofing
threats.description: An attacker could impersonate staff to manipulate order statuses, access sales reports, or modify menu items and application configurations.

threats.title: Web Application Spoofing
threats.description: An attacker might set up a fraudulent web server to phish user credentials or intercept sensitive data.

threats.title: Order Data Tampering
threats.description: An attacker could modify order details (e.g., items, quantities, prices, status) in transit or at rest.

threats.title: Menu Data Tampering
threats.description: An attacker could alter menu item data (e.g., prices or descriptions) before it is stored in the database.

threats.title: Sales Report Tampering
threats.description: Unauthorized individuals could alter sales data in the MongoDB Database, leading to falsified reports.

threats.title: Application Code/Configuration Tampering
threats.description: Malicious modification of the application’s source code, server configurations, or environment variables could introduce backdoors or disable security features.

threats.title: Fraudulent Order Repudiation
threats.description: A customer could deny placing an order if insufficient logging and non-repudiation controls are in place.

threats.title: Staff Action Repudiation
threats.description: Staff members (Barista, Manager, Administrator) could deny performing actions if audit logs are insufficient, not immutable, or can be tampered with.

threats.title: Customer PII Disclosure
threats.description: Unauthorized access to customer names, contact details, delivery addresses, and order history.

threats.title: Staff Credential Disclosure
threats.description: Exposure of usernames, passwords, or session tokens for staff members due to insecure storage or unencrypted transmission.

threats.title: Application Code and Configuration Disclosure
threats.description: Exposure of source code, server configurations, environment variables, or API keys.

threats.title: Sales Data Disclosure
threats.description: Unauthorized access to sales reports or underlying aggregated sales data.

threats.title: Web Application Server DoS
threats.description: An attacker could flood the Web Application Server with excessive requests, making it unavailable.

threats.title: MongoDB Database DoS
threats.description: Malicious or poorly optimized queries could overload the database, making it unresponsive.

threats.title: Customer to Staff Privilege Escalation
threats.description: A customer could exploit a vulnerability to gain unauthorized access to Barista, Manager, or Administrator functionalities.

threats.title: Barista/Manager to Administrator Privilege Escalation
threats.description: A Barista or Manager could exploit a vulnerability to gain Administrator privileges.

threats.title: Horizontal Privilege Escalation
threats.description: Gaining unauthorized access to another user’s account within the same privilege level.

threats.title: Order Data Tampering
threats.description: An attacker could modify order details (e.g., items, quantities, prices, status) in transit or at rest.

threats.title: Menu Data Tampering
threats.description: An attacker could alter menu item data (e.g., prices or descriptions) before it is stored in the database.

threats.title: Sales Report Tampering
threats.description: Unauthorized individuals could alter sales data in the MongoDB Database, leading to falsified reports.

threats.title: Fraudulent Order Repudiation
threats.description: A customer could deny placing an order if insufficient logging and non-repudiation controls are in place.

threats.title: Staff Action Repudiation
threats.description: Staff members (Barista, Manager, Administrator) could deny performing actions if audit logs are insufficient, not immutable, or can be tampered with.

threats.title: Customer PII Disclosure
threats.description: Unauthorized access to customer names, contact details, delivery addresses, and order history.

threats.title: Staff Credential Disclosure
threats.description: Exposure of usernames, passwords, or session tokens for staff members due to insecure storage or unencrypted transmission.

threats.title: Sales Data Disclosure
threats.description: Unauthorized access to sales reports or underlying aggregated sales data.

threats.title: MongoDB Database DoS
threats.description: Malicious or poorly optimized queries could overload the database, making it unresponsive.

data.name: sends transaction response
data.description: The response can either be a success or a failure

data.name:
send new order details 
and 
payment status
data.description: This happens only if the transaction response from the Third-Party Payment Service is successful

labels:
send new order details 
and 
payment status

data.name:
send order confirmation
and status update

labels:
send order confirmation
and status update

data.name: Success = 1
data.description: This notifies the web application that the order details and payment status that were sent to the database server are successfully recorded
